author: Daniella Silva
description: Legal advocates fighting the president's order to restrict citizenship from babies born to certain immigrants are turning to class action lawsuits to stop his policy.
title: How latest block of Trump's birthright citizenship order tests legal landscape after Supreme Court ruling

author: Ken Dilanian
description: Deputy FBI Director Dan Bongino is considering leaving his job over his frustration with how the Justice Department has handled the Jeffrey Epstein files.
title: Dan Bongino weighs resigning from FBI after heated confrontation with Pam Bondi over Epstein files

author: Reuters
description: LONDON/NEW YORK, July 11 (Reuters) - Suppliers to Walmart WMT
title: Some Walmart garment orders from Bangladesh on hold due to U.S. tariff threat

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: A U.S. citizen and manager of a Southern California cannabis farm said he was assaulted and handcuffed by federal agents during an immigration raid.
title: Cannabis farm worker in California dies day after chaotic federal immigration raid

author: The Politics Desk
description: Welcome to the online version of From the Politics Desk, an evening newsletter that brings you the NBC News Politics team’s latest reporting and analysis from the White House, Capitol Hill and the campaign trail
title: Takeaways from Trump's latest interview and how his bill plays in the states: From the Politics Desk

author: Zahin Das
description: One year ahead of hosting the FIFA World Cup, the Club World Cup is proving whether the country is fully prepared for soccer's premier tournament.
title: Club World Cup tests U.S. readiness to host next year's mega-event

description: First Lady Melania Trump offers words of sympathy to the families of Texas flood victims after touring the devastation left in Kerr County.
title: 'We are grieving with you': Melania Trump offers condolences to Texas flood victims

author: The Associated Press
description: Gervonta "Tank" Davis was arrested early Friday morning in South Florida on a misdemeanor domestic violence charge.
title: Boxer Gervonta 'Tank' Davis arrested in South Florida on domestic violence charge

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump’s pressure campaign against the Federal Reserve and Chair Jerome Powell to lower interest rates entered a new front this week
title: White House ramps up pressure on Fed's Jerome Powell three weeks before next interest rate decision

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Anxiety is growing after HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abruptly postponed a meeting this week with a panel that advise the agency about preventative health services and screenings.
title: RFK Jr. moves to cancel preventive health panel meeting raises alarm

author: Kate Dore, CFP, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump’s ‘big beautiful bill’ delivers a temporary higher limit on the federal deduction for state and local taxes, known as SALT.
title: Trump's 'big beautiful bill' could deliver 45.5% 'SALT torpedo' for high earners, tax pro says

author: Michael Rosenfield, NBC Boston
description: The man, who supported President Donald Trump though he can't vote, says he "feels differently" now and blames the administration for his immigration plight.
title: N.H. green card holder denied re-entry to U.S. after visiting native Canada

description: After surveying damage with Texas officials, President Trump held a roundtable event in Kerrville to express the "anguish of our entire nation."
title: Trump speaks from Texas after deadly floods: ‘Filled with grief and devastation’

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Pennsylvania's 911 system is experiencing statewide outages, state officials said on Friday
title: Pennsylvania 911 system experiencing statewide outages

author: Ryan Balberman
description: Russia launched more aerial attacks on Ukraine in June than in any other month of the war so far, causing a record number of civilian casualties.
title: Ukraine suffers most civilian casualties in 3 years as Russia ramps up aerial attacks

author: Andrew Greif
description: For three straight years Novak Djokovic, the Serbian star who owns the most Grand Slam titles in tennis history, has been denied a spot in Wimbledon's final.
title: Novak Djokovic's Grand Slam title drought continues after Wimbledon semifinal loss

description: Mexican influencer and TikTok star Aldo Miranda has died, according to his management
title: Aldo Miranda, Mexican TikTok star, dies at 32

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: The U.S. government posted a surplus in June as tariff receipts gave an extra bump to a sharp increase in receipts, the Treasury Department said Friday
title: Treasury posts unexpected surplus in June as tariff receipts surge

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A growing wildfire ignited by lightning is prompting evacuations near the Grand Canyon after burning through over 1,000 acres in Arizona
title: Wildfires force evacuations near Grand Canyon

description: A hyperbaric chamber caught fire in Arizona, leading to the gruesome death of a 43-year-old man inside the highly pressurized, oxygen-filled compartment, authorities said Thursday
title: Arizona man is killed while inside a hyperbaric chamber that caught fire

author: Dalila Muata
description: The use of AI recruiters has rolled out quickly among major companies despite glitches and privacy concerns.
title: Looking for a job? An AI recruiter might interview you next

author: David K. Li
description: Los Angeles Chargers running back Najee Harris suffered a "superficial eye injury" during a Fourth of July fireworks "mishap," but should be ready to play this fall, his agent said.
title: Chargers running back Najee Harris injured in fireworks 'mishap' on Fourth of July

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A person in northern Arizona has died from a case of bubonic plague, local health officials said.
title: Arizona patient dies in emergency room from plague

author: The Associated Press
description: A small town in Tennessee courted national  attention a century ago when local leaders planned a test trial over the teaching of evolution in public schools.
title: Tired of put-downs, Tennessee town corrects the record with play about the Scopes trial it hosted

author: The Associated Press
description: The Trump administration on Thursday opened a civil rights investigation into the hiring practices at George Mason University, expanding a national campaign against diversity policies to Virginia's largest public university
title: George Mason University faces investigation in Trump administration's anti-DEI crackdown

author: The Associated Press
description: Carlos Alcaraz moved within one victory of a third consecutive Wimbledon championship and sixth Grand Slam title overall at age 22 by defeating Taylor Fritz 6-4, 5-7, 6-3, 7-6 (6) on Friday.
title: Two-time defending champion Carlos Alcaraz beats Taylor Fritz to reach the Wimbledon final

author: David K. Li
description: A brazen thief stole more than $113,000 worth of Pokémon cards from a Massachusetts store, officials said Friday, launching a real-life Pokémon Go search for the suspect and the rare collectibles
title: Over $113K worth of rare Pokémon cards stolen from Massachusetts store

author: Shane Lou, TODAY
description: In October 2018, Nikki Bella was one of the featured superstars in a historic WWE event called Evolution.
title: Nikki Bella discusses WWE Evolution

author: The Associated Press
description: DENVER — A Denver museum known for its dinosaur displays has made a fossil bone discovery closer to home than anyone ever expected, under its own parking lot
title: A Denver dino museum makes a find deep under own parking lot

author: Jamie Guirola, NBC Miami
description: Archbishop Thomas Wenski criticized the remote location of the detention site called  "Alligator Alcatraz" and the rhetoric surrounding it.
title: Miami archbishop slams 'Alligator Alcatraz' as 'unbecoming' and 'corrosive'

author: Scott Friedman
description: FEMA records obtained by NBC 5 Investigates show that Kerr County officials did not use FEMA’s Integrated Public Alert & Warning System to send warnings with safety instructions to all mobile phones in the affected area during critical hours as the flooding began on July 4.Researchers who have studied the cell phone warning system told NBC 5 Investigates that policies on how and when to issue critical alerts vary widely from one county to another, potentially risking delays when seconds count
title: FEMA records show Kerr County didn't alert all cell phones as flooding began

author: Sarah Whitten, CNBC
description: IMAX is quickly gaining market share as moviegoers spend more to see blockbusters like "F1," "Sinners" and "Superman" on the biggest screens.
title: IMAX heads for best year ever as it capitalizes on box office rebound

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: After a week of severe storms that soaked the East Coast and triggered devastating floods in the South, more rain is on the way with a renewed flood threat for still-reeling Texas and New Mexico
title: More storms to drench Midwest, hard-hit Texas and New Mexico this weekend

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Babies receiving critical care in Gaza risk becoming much sicker or even dying in the coming days as the enclave runs out of fuel and hospitals are forced to turn off incubators, doctors warn
title: Gaza babies' lives at risk as Israel blocks fuel used in hospitals

description: President Donald Trump threatens Canada with a 35% tariff, further disrupting the economic relationship with one of the United States’ closest allies and biggest trading partners. He told Meet the Press moderator Kristen Welker that he plans to set a blanket tariff of 15%-20% on most nations, calling the tariffs so far “very well received.” NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Threatens Canada With 35% Tariffs Amid Trade Talks

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump ramped up the U.S. trade war with Canada and threatened blanket tariffs on other countries.
title: Trump unleashes more tariff threats and four big U.S. storms in less than a week: Morning Rundown

description: Termination notices were expected to hit inboxes  this morning, according to sources. It would be the agency's biggest reorganization in decades.
title: Mass layoffs expected today at the State Department

description: Seven days after the flood waters left devastation in parts of Texas, President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump are set to survey the aftermath and meet with first responders and families. It comes as stories of survival and heroism continue to emerge as questions rise over warnings to people in harm’s way. NBC’s Morgan Chesky reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Set to Survey Aftermath of Devastating Texas Floods

author: Fredlyn Pierre Louis
description: An immigrant couple whose employment authorization recently expired is relying on members of the Texas church that helped them flee Haiti to stay afloat while they fight deportation.
title: With expired work permits, couple who fled Haiti leans on Texas church that brought them here

author: Liz Calvario, TODAY
description: Justin Bieber shocked fans by dropping a surprise album, his first in more than four years, after days of posting photos of himself in the studio
title: Justin Bieber Releases New Album, 'Swag,' With Surprise Drop

author: The Associated Press
description: European officials reached a new deal with Israel to allow desperately needed food and fuel into Gaza, hours after an Israeli airstrike killed 15 people.
title: Europe unveils a deal for more food and fuel for Gaza. Israeli strike kills 15 outside a clinic

author: Reuters
description: Chris Brown pleaded not guilty to a charge of assault causing actual bodily harm by allegedly attacking a music producer with a bottle in a London nightclub two years ago.
title: U.S. singer Chris Brown pleads not guilty to lesser assault charge in U.K. court

description: Nasser Hospital, the only major hospital serving southern Gaza, said it is on the verge of shutting down due to a severe fuel shortage. Head of the hospital’s pediatric unit, Dr. Ahmad Al-Farra, told an NBC News crew in Gaza that without fuel for the generator, babies receiving critical care risk becoming sicker or even dying.
title: ‘This baby will not survive’: Gaza’s Nasser Hospital faces shut down over fuel shortage

author: Shreya Srinivasan
description: Researchers found an 11% higher risk for cardiovascular disease in women diagnosed with severe symptoms, not just mild or moderate cramps.
title: Premenstrual disorders may lead to a higher risk for heart disease, study finds

author: The Associated Press
description: Thousands of people from Bosnia and around the world gathered in Srebrenica to mark the 30th anniversary of a 1995 massacre of more than 8,000 boys and men.
title: Thousands gather in Srebrenica on 30th anniversary of Europe's only acknowledged genocide since WWII

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Amanda Anisimova, the 12th-ranked women’s tennis player in the world, advanced to the Wimbledon final by shocking top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka in the semifinals Thursday.
title: Amanda Anisimova walked away from tennis 2 years ago. Now she could win Wimbledon.

author: NBC New York
description: The man convicted of viciously beating a 57-year-old woman with a hammer outside a subway station was sentenced Thursday to 25 years in life in prison.
title: Man in notorious NYC hammer attack gets up to life in prison

author: Nnamdi Egwuonwu
description: The president has defended his administration's response to the fatal flooding amid criticism that federal assistance could've been provided more quickly.
title: Trump heads to Texas as recovery efforts from deadly flood continue

author: Adam Edelman
description: State lawmakers are scrambling to deal with the expected financial fallout from President Donald Trump’s “One Big Beautiful Bill,” with many in blue states demanding special legislative sessions they say are necessary to shore up funding for health care and food assistance programs affected by the new law
title: Blue-state leaders weigh new laws to deal with financial fallout from Trump's big bill

author: The Associated Press
description: Two employees at an Arkansas prison where an inmate known as the “Devil in the Ozarks” escaped have been fired, corrections officials said Thursday.
title: Arkansas prison employees fired after 'Devil in the Ozarks' escape

author: Zoe Malin
description: Prime Day ends tonight and deals are just as good today as they’ve been so far — in some cases, we’ve seen prices drop lower from Apple, Kindle, Dyson and more.
title: The 73+ best Prime Day deals to shop before they’re gone for good

author: Phil Helsel
description: The FBI is offering a $50,000 reward in the search for someone who appeared to fire a pistol at federal immigration agents during protests Thursday near Los Angeles, the U.S. attorney for the region said.U.S.
title: Feds offer $50,000 reward in apparent firing of gun at agents after clash with protesters

author: Andrea Mitchell
description: Israel believes at least some of Iran’s highly enriched uranium was buried by U.S. strikes and not destroyed or moved beforehand.
title: Some of Iran's enriched uranium survived U.S. bombing, Israeli official says

author: Alex Portée
description: Justin Bieber is sending fans into a frenzy after sharing a series of intimate family portraits on his Instagram stories along with clues of an imminent album drop
title: Justin Bieber shares family photos — and hints that a new album is coming

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Texas state Sen. Angela Paxton said Thursday she had filed for divorce from her husband, state Attorney General Ken Paxton, who is challenging U.S.
title: Texas state Sen. Angela Paxton files for divorce from husband, state AG Ken Paxton

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump announced Thursday that the United States would apply a 35% tariff to all imports from Canada beginning next month, reviving tensions with a major trade partner that had largely dissipated in recent weeks."Instead of working with the United States, Canada retaliated with its own Tariffs," Trump wrote in the letter shared on Truth Social.
title: Trump says he will hit Canadian imports with a 35% tariff in major escalation of trade war

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Days after the mysterious killing of a paddleboarder in Maine, state law enforcement officials said they are continuing to review leads and urged residents to remain vigilant.“The Maine State Police recognizes the fear and discomfort that this incident has brought to the town of Union and the Crawford Pond community,” Maine State Police said in a statement Wednesday.
title: After a paddleboarder's unsolved killing in Maine, authorities urge people to stay vigilant

author: Phil Helsel
description: President Donald Trump on Thursday expressed support for flood alarms in Texas and said he thinks “everyone’s doing a great job” responding to a disaster that has left more than 100 people dead and 170 people missing.“After having seen this horrible event, I would imagine you’d put alarms up in some form, where alarms would go up if they see any large amounts of water or whatever it is,” Trump told NBC News’ "Meet the Press" moderator Kristen Welker in a phone interview Thursday.��
title: Trump calls for alarms after deadly Texas floods
